definition: (of an actor) to bring (one's character) to life/to act brilliantly
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act

sentences.english: From here on he brings the character confidently alive.
sentences.chinese: 从这里开始他真正将这个角色演活了。

sentences.english: Every character he played came to life.
sentences.chinese: 他所演的每个角色都被他演活了。

sentences.english: This movie brought the Middle Ages to life.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影演活了中古世纪的情景。

sentences.english: The boy acted his part with great animation.
sentences.chinese: 这个男孩把他的角度演活了。

sentences.english: For her next outing, Lopez got ant? imated20, in the DreamWorks tale Antz.
sentences.chinese: 洛佩兹接着演活了在梦工场的故事片《蚂蚁》。

sentences.english: "I thought the guy who played me did a fantastic job, " said Jobs.
sentences.chinese: 乔说，“我觉得扮演我的演员把角色给演活了。”

definition: to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
role/character in a novel/persona/also pr. [jiao3 se4]
to appear (in a show etc)/an appearance (on stage etc)
to play the role of/to act
(of a story etc) to unfold/to play out/to develop (a technique etc)/to enact/(logic) to deduce/to infer
(Chinese opera) to play a role outside of one's specialty/(modern) to play a transvestite role/to masquerade as an opponent
to model/to mold/(fig.) to create (a character, a market, an image etc)/(literature) to portray (in words)
